title: Meghan Markle's eagle-eyed fans spot adorable reflection during her interview
text:

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's behind-the-scenes documentary gave fans an inside look at their Africa Royal Tour, and was filled with sweet and extremely honest moments.

Both gave one-to-one interviews during ITV's hour-long special, speaking about the causes they are passionate about as well as their struggles with life in the spotlight.

But there is one moment that got people very, very excited - and it wasn't even meant to be part of the show.

While Meghan speaks to news anchor Tom Bradby about the "optimism" of people in South Africa, a reflection of Harry can be seen in the window behind him.

(Image: ITV)

The proud dad is cradling and bouncing his little boy Archie, who had just carried out his first ever official engagement by meeting Archbishop Desmond Tutu.

People took to social media to share their love for the sweet moment, and many said it was their favourite part of the whole show.

One wrote: "My favourite part of Harry & Meghan: An African Journey. Reflection of Harry cuddling Archie."

Another commented: "Meghan is saying something important but I can't keep my eyes off the duo in the left side corner.....Harry and Archie."

(Image: ITV)

Meanwhile, Meghan says: "It's my first time in South Africa. You can talk about all the issues that are important to you and really advocate for them but then when you're on the ground and you experience it and you're seeing what's happening it resonates in a different way.

"The biggest take away I'm stuck by is how much optimism there is. These women, and these young girls especially, are really just so empowered and that's uplifting.

"You go there and you feel it so deeply inside, so it was a really strong start for our trip."

During the documentary Harry also address rumours of a rift between him and brother Prince William, and appeared to confirm difficulties in their relationship.

Tom Bradby says: “It has been a year of big change, with all the complications that brings.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: ITV)

"This includes the decision to split his office off from that of his brother, to whom he has always been close.”

The news presenter then asked about the truth to ­speculation of a rift.

Harry said: “Part of this role and part of this job and this family being under the pressure that it’s under ­inevitably, you know, stuff happens.

“But look, we’re brothers. We’ll always be brothers.

"We’re certainly on different paths at the moment but I will always be there for him and as I know he’ll always be there for me.

“You know, we don’t see each other as much as we, as much as we used to because we’re so busy.

"But, I love him dearly and, you know, the majority of the stuff is created out of nothing.

"Just as I said, as brothers, you know, you have good days, you have bad days.”
description: Many fans have said that Prince Harry and Archie's cute moment in the background of Meghan Markle's interview was their favourite moment of the Harry and Meghan: An African Journey documentary
